TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract Chart

Docs.summary: Represents a chart in a document.

remarks.para: The following properties and methods for returning a Chart object are described in the example section:

example.para: The collection contains an object for each inline shape, including charts, in a document. Use InlineShapes(), where is the index number of an inline shape, to return a single InlineShape object. Use the property to determine if the InlineShape object represents a chart. If the HasChart property is set to True, use the property to return a Chart object.
You can also use the property to determine if the InlineShape object represents a chart. If the Type property is set to WdInlineShapeChart, the inline shape represents a chart.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Application { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: When used without an object qualifier, this property returns an object that represents the Microsoft Word application. When used with an object qualifier, this property returns an Application object that represents the creator of the specified object (you can use this property with an OLE Automation object to return the application of that object). Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ApplyChartTemplate([in]string FileName) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required String The file name for a chart template.
Docs.summary: Applies a standard or custom chart type to a chart.

remarks.para: This method does not support taking constants for native or combination charts.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ApplyCustomType (Microsoft.Office.Core.XlChartType ChartType, object TypeName);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ApplyCustomType([in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Core.XlChartType ChartType, [in]object TypeName) runtime managed
Public Sub ApplyCustomType (ChartType As XlChartType, Optional TypeName As Object)

Docs.param: Required A standard chart type
Required Object A standard chart type
Docs.summary: Applies a standard or custom chart type to a chart.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ApplyDataLabels (Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XlDataLabelsType Type = Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XlDataLabelsType.xlDataLabelsShowValue, object LegendKey, object AutoText, object HasLeaderLines, object ShowSeriesName, object ShowCategoryName, object ShowValue, object ShowPercentage, object ShowBubbleSize, object Separator);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ApplyDataLabels([in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XlDataLabelsType Type, [in]object LegendKey, [in]object AutoText, [in]object HasLeaderLines, [in]object ShowSeriesName, [in]object ShowCategoryName, [in]object ShowValue, [in]object ShowPercentage, [in]object ShowBubbleSize, [in]object Separator) runtime managed

Public Sub ApplyDataLabels (Optional Type As XlDataLabelsType = Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XlDataLabelsType.xlDataLabelsShowValue, Optional LegendKey As Object, Optional AutoText As Object, Optional HasLeaderLines As Object, Optional ShowSeriesName As Object, Optional ShowCategoryName As Object, Optional ShowValue As Object, Optional ShowPercentage As Object, Optional ShowBubbleSize As Object, Optional Separator As Object)

Docs.param: Required The type of data label to apply.
True to show the legend key next to the point. The default value is False.
True if the object automatically generates appropriate text based on content.
For the and objects, True if the series has leader lines.
Pass a boolean value to enable or disable the series name for the data label.
Pass a boolean value to enable or disable the category name for the data label.
Pass a boolean value to enable or disable the value for the data label.
a boolean value to enable or disable the percentage for the data label.
Pass a boolean value to enable or disable the bubble size for the data label.
The separator for the data label.
Docs.summary: Applies data labels to all the series in a chart.

remarks.para: The following table shows the arguments that can be passed to the parameter of a method.

item.description: xlDataLabelsShowBubbleSizes. The bubble size for the data label.
xlDataLabelsShowLabelAndPercent. Percentage of the total, and category for the point. Available only for pie charts and doughnut charts.
xlDataLabelsShowPercent. Percentage of the total. Available only for pie charts and doughnut charts.
xlDataLabelsShowValue. default. Value for the point (assumed if this argument isn't specified).

MemberSignature.Value: public void ApplyLayout (int Layout, object ChartType);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ApplyLayout([in]int32 Layout, [in]object ChartType) runtime managed
Public Sub ApplyLayout (Layout As Integer, Optional ChartType As Object)

Docs.param: Integer Specifies the type of layout. The type of layout is denoted by a number from 1 to 10.
Object that contains a XlChartType constant representing the type of chart.
Docs.summary: Applies the layouts shown in the ribbon.

remarks.para: When you use a layout on the current chart type, a number from 1 to 10 is applied to the chart type. You can also apply the layout of one chart type on another chart type. For example, you can apply the layouts that are available from a line chart to a column chart. The layout only adds chart elements that are available for that particular chart type.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Area3DGroup As ChartGroup

Docs.summary: Returns the area chart group on a 3-D chart.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object AreaGroups([in]object Index) runtime managed
Public Function AreaGroups (Optional Index As Object) As Object

Docs.param: Optional Object The chart group number.
Docs.summary: On a 2-D chart, returns an object that represents either a single area chart group (a object) or a collection of the area chart groups (a collection).

MemberSignature.Value: public void AutoFormat (int Gallery, object Format);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AutoFormat([in]int32 Gallery, [in]object Format) runtime managed
Public Sub AutoFormat (Gallery As Integer, Optional Format As Object)

Docs.summary: This API supports the Visual Studio Tools for Office infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoScaling { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Scales a 3-D chart so that it's closer in size to the equivalent 2-D chart. The property must be True. Read/write.
Docs.value: Boolean True if Microsoft Word scales a 3-d chart so that it is closer in size to the equivalent 2-d chart; otherwise, False.

MemberSignature.Value: public object Axes (object Type, Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XlAxisGroup AxisGroup = Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XlAxisGroup.xlPrimary);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Axes([in]object Type, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XlAxisGroup AxisGroup) runtime managed
Public Function Axes (Optional Type As Object, Optional AxisGroup As XlAxisGroup = Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XlAxisGroup.xlPrimary) As Object

Docs.param: Required Object Specifies the axis to return. Can be one of the following constants: xlValue, xlCategory, or xlSeriesAxis (xlSeriesAxis is valid only for 3-D charts).
Optional Specifies the axis group. If this argument is omitted, the primary group is used. 3-D charts have only one axis group.
Docs.summary: Gets an object that either represents a single axis or a collection of axes on the chart.

public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Walls ^ BackWall { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Walls ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that allows the user to individually format the back wall of a 3-D chart. Read-only.

Docs.summary: On a 2-D chart, returns an object that represents either a single bar chart group (a object) or a collection of the bar chart groups (a collection).

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the shape used for every series in a 3-D bar or column chart. Read/write.

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an constant that specifies the source level of the chart category labels. Read-write.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ChartArea As ChartArea

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the complete chart area for the chart. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ ChartColor { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an integer that represents the color scheme for the chart. Read-write.

remarks.para: Chart color schemes are numbered from 1 to 17; the setting of this property corresponds to the color schemes shown on the Change Colors gallery on the Chart Tools Design ribbon tab.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ChartData As ChartData

Docs.summary: Returns information about the linked or embedded data associated with a chart. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ChartGroups(Optional Index As Object) As Object
public: property System::Object ^ ChartGroups[System::Object ^] { System::Object ^ get(System::Object ^ Index); };

Docs.param: The chart group number. If specified, a single object is returned. If omitted, a object is returned which contains a collection of every object for that chart.
Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents either a single chart group or a collection of all the chart groups in the chart.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ ChartStyle { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the chart style for the chart. Read/write Object.

remarks.para: You can use a number from 1 to 48 to set the chart style.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ChartTitle As ChartTitle

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the title of the specified chart. Read-only.

remarks.para: The object doesn’t exist and cannot be used unless the property for the chart is True.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Core::XlChartType ChartType { Microsoft::Office::Core::XlChartType get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Core::XlChartType value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the chart type. Read/write.

remarks.para: Some chart types aren’t available for PivotChart reports.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ChartWizard (object Source, object Gallery, object Format, object PlotBy, object CategoryLabels, object SeriesLabels, object HasLegend, object Title, object CategoryTitle, object ValueTitle, object ExtraTitle);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ChartWizard([in]object Source, [in]object Gallery, [in]object Format, [in]object PlotBy, [in]object CategoryLabels, [in]object SeriesLabels, [in]object HasLegend, [in]object Title, [in]object CategoryTitle, [in]object ValueTitle, [in]object ExtraTitle) runtime managed

Public Sub ChartWizard (Optional Source As Object, Optional Gallery As Object, Optional Format As Object, Optional PlotBy As Object, Optional CategoryLabels As Object, Optional SeriesLabels As Object, Optional HasLegend As Object, Optional Title As Object, Optional CategoryTitle As Object, Optional ValueTitle As Object, Optional ExtraTitle As Object)

Docs.param: Optional Object the range that contains the source data for the new chart. If this argument is omitted, Microsoft Word edits the active chart sheet or the selected chart on the active worksheet.
Optional Object contains one of the constants of specifying the chart type.

Optional Object the option number for the built-in autoformats. Can be a number from 1 through 10, depending on the gallery type. If this argument is omitted, Microsoft Word chooses a default value based on the gallery type and data source.
Optional Object specifies whether the data for each series is in rows or columns. Can be one of the following constants: xlRows or xlColumns.

Optional Object contains an Integer specifying the number of rows or columns within the source range that contain category labels. Legal values are from 0 (zero) through one less than the maximum number of the corresponding categories or series.

Optional Object contains an Integer specifying the number of rows or columns within the source range that contain series labels. Legal values are from 0 (zero) through one less than the maximum number of the corresponding categories or series.
Optional Object set to True to include a legend.
Optional Object the chart title text.
Optional Object the category axis title text.
Optional Object the value axis title text.
Optional Object the series axis title for 3-D charts or the second value axis title for 2-D charts.
Docs.summary: Modifies the properties of the given chart. You can use this method to quickly format a chart without setting all the individual properties. This method is non-interactive, and it changes only the specified properties.

remarks.para: If is omitted and the selection isn't a chart on the active document, this method fails and an error occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ClearToMatchColorStyle() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Clears all colors on the specified chart that do not follow the color style applied to the chart.

remarks.para: Use this method to reset all the chart color formatting to the color style applied to the chart.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ClearToMatchStyle() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Clears the chart elements formatting to automatic.

remarks.para: Use this method to reset the chart elements formatting to automatic. If you use this method on a chart, all formatting (including overrides) will be reset.

Docs.param: Optional Specifies how the picture should be copied. The default value is .
Optional The format of the picture. The default value is .
Optional The size of the copied picture when the object is a chart on a chart sheet (not embedded on a worksheet). The default value is .
Docs.summary: Copies the selected object to the Clipboard as a picture.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Corners As Corners
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Corners ^ Corners { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Corners ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the corners of a 3-D chart.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit Integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created. Read-only.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Word, the property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD". This property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DataTable As DataTable

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the chart data table. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Delete() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Deletes the object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void DeleteHiddenContent() runtime managed

Docs.summary: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int DepthPercent { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the depth of a 3-D chart as a percentage of the chart width (between 20 and 2000 percent). Read/write.

remarks.para: This property applies only to 3-D charts.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlDisplayBlanksAs DisplayBlanksAs { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlDisplayBlanksAs get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlDisplayBlanksAs value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the way that blank cells are plotted on a chart. Can be one of the constants. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object DoughnutGroups([in]object Index) runtime managed
Public Function DoughnutGroups (Optional Index As Object) As Object

Docs.param: Optional Object. Specifies the chart group.
Docs.summary: On a 2-D chart, returns an object that represents either a single doughnut chart group (a object) or a collection of the doughnut chart groups (a collection).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Elevation { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the elevation of the 3-D chart view, in degrees. Read/write.

remarks.para: The chart elevation is the height at which you view the chart, in degrees. The default is 15 for most chart types. The value of this property must be between -90 and 90, except for 3-D bar charts, where it must be between 0 and 44.
Note: This property applies only to 3-D charts.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Export (string FileName, object FilterName, object Interactive);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Export([in]string FileName, [in]object FilterName, [in]object Interactive) runtime managed
Public Function Export (FileName As String, Optional FilterName As Object, Optional Interactive As Object) As Boolean

Docs.param: Required String The name of the exported file.
Optional Object The language-independent name of the graphic filter as it appears in the registry.
Optional ObjectTrue to display the dialog box that contains the filter-specific options. If this argument is False, Microsoft Word uses the default values for the filter. The default value is False.
Docs.summary: Exports the chart in a graphic format. This method returns a Boolean value indicating whether the export was successful.

public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Floor ^ Floor { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Floor ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the floor of the 3-D chart. Read-only.

Public Function FullSeriesCollection (Optional Index As Object) As Object

Docs.param: The index number in the series collection of the series to return.
Docs.summary: Returns the collection of all the series in the specified chart, or the specified series.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int GapDepth { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the distance between the data series in a 3-D chart, as a percentage of the marker width. The value of this property must be between 0 and 500. Read/write.

remarks.para: Note: This property applies only to 3-D charts.

MemberSignature.Value: public void GetChartElement (int x, int y, out int ElementID, out int Arg1, out int Arg2);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void GetChartElement([in]int32 x, [in]int32 y, [out] int32& ElementID, [out] int32& Arg1, [out] int32& Arg2) runtime managed
Public Sub GetChartElement (x As Integer, y As Integer, ByRef ElementID As Integer, ByRef Arg1 As Integer, ByRef Arg2 As Integer)
public: void GetChartElement(int x, int y, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] int % ElementID, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] int % Arg1, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] int % Arg2);

Docs.param: Required Integer The X coordinate of the chart element.
Required Integer The Y coordinate of the chart element.
Integer When the method returns, this argument contains the value of the chart element at the specified coordinates. For more information, see the “Remarks” section.
Integer When the method returns, this argument contains information related to the chart element. For more information, see the “Remarks” section.
Integer When the method returns, this argument contains information related to the chart element. For more information, see the “Remarks” section.
Docs.summary: Returns information about the chart element at specified X and Y coordinates. This method is unusual in that you specify values for only the first two arguments. Microsoft Word fills in the other arguments, and your code should examine those values when the method returns.

remarks.para: The value of after the method returns determines whether and contain any information, as shown in the following table.
The following table describes the meaning of and after the method returns.

item.description: Specifies whether the axis is primary or secondary. Can be one of the following constants: xlPrimary or xlSecondary.
Specifies the axis type. Can be one of the following constants: xlCategory, xlSeriesAxis, or xlValue.

Specifies the drop zone type: column, data, page, or row field. Can be one of the following constants: xlColumnField, xlDataField, xlPageField, or xlRowField. The column and row field constants specify the series and category fields, respectively.
Specifies the offset within the collection for a specific chart group.
Specifies the offset within the collection for a specific point within a series. A value of – 1 indicates that all data points are selected.
Specifies the offset within the collection for a specific series.
Specifies the offset within the collection for a specific shape.
Specifies the offset within the collection for a specific trendline within a series.

MemberSignature.Value: public object HasAxis[object Index1, object Index2] { get; set; }
Public Property HasAxis(Optional Index1 As Object, Optional Index2 As Object) As Object

public: property System::Object ^ HasAxis[System::Object ^, System::Object ^] { System::Object ^ get(System::Object ^ Index1, System::Object ^ Index2); void set(System::Object ^ Index1, System::Object ^ Index2, System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.param: Required Object The axis type. Series axes apply only to 3-D charts. Can be one of the constants.
Optional Object The axis group. 3-D charts have only one set of axes. Can be one of the constants.
Docs.summary: Returns or sets which axes exist on the chart. Read/write.

remarks.para: You must enter a value for at least one of the parameters when setting this property.
Microsoft Word may create or delete axes if you change the chart type or the property.

Docs.summary: Determines if the PivotChart controls are displayed on the specified PivotChart report
Docs.value: Boolean For a regular chart, this property always returns False and cannot be set.

remarks.para: The default value is True

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool HasTitle { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the axis or chart has a visible title. Read/write.

remarks.para: A chart title is represented by a object.

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the height of a 3-D chart as a percentage of the chart width (between 5 and 500 percent). Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Paste([in]object Type) runtime managed
Public Sub Paste (Optional Type As Object)

Docs.param: Specifies the chart information to paste if a chart is on the Clipboard. Can be one of the following xlPasteFormats, xlPasteFormulas, or xlPasteAll. The default value is xlPasteAll. If there’s data other than a chart on the Clipboard, this argument cannot be used. paste
Docs.summary: Pastes chart data from the Clipboard into the specified chart.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Perspective { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an Integer value that represents the perspective for the 3-D chart view.

remarks.para: The value of this property must be between 0 and 100. This property is ignored if the property is set to True.

public: property System::Object ^ PivotLayout { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Not supported for this object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PlotArea As PlotArea

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the plot area of a chart. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlRowCol PlotBy { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlRowCol get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlRowCol value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the way columns or rows are used as data series on the chart. Can be one of the following constants: xlColumns or xlRows. Read/write.

remarks.para: For PivotChart reports, this property is read-only and always returns xlColumns.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool PlotVisibleOnly { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or Sets a value that indicates whether only visible cells are plotted. Read/write.
Docs.value: Boolean True if only visible cells are plotted. False if both visible and hidden cells are plotted.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object RadarGroups([in]object Index) runtime managed
Public Function RadarGroups (Optional Index As Object) As Object

Docs.param: Optional Object Specifies the chart group.
Docs.summary: On a 2-D chart, returns an object that represents either a single radar chart group (a object) or a collection of the radar chart groups (a collection).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Refresh() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Causes the specified chart to be redrawn immediately.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ RightAngleAxes { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.summary: True if the chart axes are at right angles, independent of chart rotation or elevation. Applies only to 3-D line, column, and bar charts. Read/write.

remarks.para: If this property is set to True, the property is ignored.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ Rotation { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the rotation of the 3-D chart view (the rotation of the plot area around the z-axis, in degrees). The value of this property must be from 0 to 360, except for 3-D bar charts, where the value must be from 0 to 44. The default value is 20. Applies only to 3-D charts. Read/write.

remarks.para: Rotations are always rounded to the nearest integer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SaveChartTemplate([in]string FileName) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required String The name of the chart template.
Docs.summary: Saves a custom chart template to the list of available chart templates.

remarks.para: By default, this method saves the active chart to the user's chart template directory. If a UNC or URL is specified, the chart will be saved to the specified location instead.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Select([in]object Replace) runtime managed
Public Function Select (Optional Replace As Object) As Object

Docs.param: (used only with sheets). Optional ObjectTrue to replace the current selection with the specified object. False to extend the current selection to include any previously selected objects and the specified object.
Docs.summary: Selects the object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object SeriesCollection([in]object Index) runtime managed
Public Function SeriesCollection (Optional Index As Object) As Object

Docs.param: Required Object The name or number of the series.
Docs.summary: Returns an Object that represents all the series in the chart.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetDefaultChart([in]object Name) runtime managed

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ShowDataLabelsOverMaximum { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets whether to show the data labels when the value is greater than the maximum value on the value axis. Read/write.

remarks.para: If you change the value axis in such a way that it became smaller than the size of the data points, you can use this property to set whether to show the data labels. This property applies to 2-D charts only.
